invent.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to make, design, or think of a new type of thing
invent.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: Alexander Graham Bell invented the telephone in 1876.
invent.translation[0].definitions[1].def: to think of an idea, story etc that is not true, usually in order to deceive people
invent.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: They invented a very convincing alibi.
invent.translation[0].note_box[0].sectio: invent
to think of an idea for a new product, machine etc, and design it or make it
The telephone was invented by Alexander Graham Bell.
Who invented the Internet?
create
to make or design something new and original
We decided to create the software ourselves.
For her latest book, she has created a whole new group of characters.
think of something/think up something
to produce a new idea, plan, method, excuse etc by thinking
I’ve thought of an idea.
They’re always trying to think up new ways to improve efficiency.
come up with something
to produce a new idea, a way of dealing with something etc, especially a good one
How did you come up with that idea?
Ellis came up with the solution to the problem immediately.
make something up
to invent a story, song, game, excuse etc
My mother used to make up bedtime stories for us.
I didn’t want to go to the class, so I decided to make up an excuse.
dream something up
to think of an idea or plan, especially one that seems unusual or even crazy
It can’t be easy dreaming up new advertisements all the time.
I wonder who dreamt up that idea!
devise
to invent a way of doing something, especially one that is clever or complicated
This system was devised as a way of measuring students’ progress.
conceive
to think of a new idea, plan etc and develop it in your mind
The project was originally conceived by a Dutch businessman two years ago.
invent.translation[1].definitions[0].def: to make, design or produce something new or a new way of doing something
invent.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: Percy Spencer invented the microwave oven.
Mr. Monaghan virtually invented the modern pizza delivery business when he founded Domino’s.
invent.translation[1].definitions[1].def: to tell people something that is not true in order to deceive them
invent.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: He told investors the firm had monthly returns of between 10% and 25% but those returns were invented.
Perhaps the most popular fraud is to inflate or invent business expenses.
